Very Brief Testimony
content.p: I was saved as a youth while living in the Houston area. I didn't walk with the Lord and was pretty rebellious. When I went away to college, I didn't want to attend church and wanted to declare my freedom from attending with my mom. In the later years of college, I began to feel empty and a desire to return back to the Lord, after trying most of what the world has to offer. A friend and I tried out a local church and got plugged in, and that is where I rededicated my life to the Lord, and first felt the call to full-time ministry. I also met my wife there. I graduated and moved to Austin and started working for Emerson Electric. I got married a year later and we were blessed with 3 boys over the years. We were attending an Independent Baptist church for most of this time, and heavily involved in the leadership. We left that church in 1999-2000 and attended Calvary Austin and were hooked from the start. It was our first exposure to a Calvary, and we loved it. We have served in various capacities here over the last few years, and accepted a position in December 2003 as Executive Director, leaving Corporate America and a 15 year career behind with little thought, knowing it was God's calling in our lives.
content.heading: Favorite Book of the Bible and Why
content.p: Psalms-I can't help but be brought into worship when I read it.
content.heading: Favorite Verse and Why
content.p: Galatians 6:9, It is a promise to overcome and succeed if we will not give up and continue to wait upon the Lord.
content.heading: Favorite Book (besides the Bible) and Why
content.p: Ordering Your Private World by Gordon MacDonald. It is a good review of our priorities and spiritual world, to make sure that we are balanced and don't crumble in this world.
content.heading: Who do you most admire (besides Jesus)
content.p: Andrew Murray-He seemed to have such a grasp on prayer and a relationship with the Lord, and I aspire to follow in his shoes and have that type of relationship with Christ and understanding of spiritual things.
content.heading: What do you do at Calvary
content.p: I am the Executive Director, overseeing the church staff and administration.
